title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message:
Machine was covered in coke.... The whole bottle I think.
Damaged areas were:
U6100, U1900, Q8150, U1950, U5000, U7100, U8300, J8300, U7090, J9500, Q7155, Q7706

Cleaned up all areas, and replaced all caps and resistors and ICs with corroded pins / pads that I could see, except the SMC (so far) as the outer balls look OK.
 
Voltages tested are:
PPBUS_G3H = 8.6
PP5V_S5 = 5V
PP3V3_S5 = 3V3
PP3V42 = 3V42
PP3V3RTC_G3H = 3V3

After randomly stabbing the wrong pin (pin 3) on U1900 (trying to test for PP3V3_S5 on pin 2), found that SYSCLK is blipping on / off.

Still very much in confusion and trying to figure out the order in which power rails turn on.

Where I should be looking first with this?

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message: First look at 5V_S4 at L7520, it is probably pulsing. Judging by your description this thing is a hell hole.....

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 7761"]First look at 5V_S4 at L7520, it is probably pulsing. Judging by your description this thing is a hell hole.....[/QUOTE]

No pulsing at L7520.
No PM_SLP_S4_L

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message:
OK, so now have fan spin and only green light. CPU gets hot. Fan is not doing the start / stop like it should. I'll throw on the heat sink, stop burning my finger and test some voltages again.

I think there was an issue around U1950

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message: this may work after a 30 second 80 celsius cleaning in the UC. but it sounds like a fucked board with a bad CPU

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message:
[QUOTE="larossmann, post: 7766"]this may work after a 30 second 80 celsius cleaning in the UC. but it sounds like a fucked board with a bad CPU [/QUOTE]

Why bad CPU?

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message: 00165 does not start/stop, only 3437 and 3435.

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 7775"]00165 does not start/stop, only 3437 and 3435.[/QUOTE]

Oh OK.
Since whenever I ask a question that requires a longer answer here, it's skipped, please would you provide a yes or no answer to this...

5V_S4 can only turn on with PM_SLP_S4 right?

And the signal for.....

What tells the PCH to turn on PM_SLP_S4?

Thank you

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message:
There is no answer for that that does not require reading and understanding the 500+ page datasheet on the Intel PCH, but here you go:

[url]http://www.intel.com/content/dam/www/public/us/en/documents/datasheets/7-series-chipset-pch-datasheet.pdf[/url]

Read that and you will understand why I cannot answer why your SLP_S4 is not there.
I did ask if it was pulsing, could pulse once or could cycle. Measure while plugging in power to not miss the one pulse. Use a scope as multimeter is too slow to catch a single pulse.

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 7788"]There is no answer for that that does not require reading and understanding the 500+ page datasheet on the Intel PCH, but here you go:

[URL="http://www.intel.com/content/dam/www/public/us/en/documents/datasheets/7-series-chipset-pch-datasheet.pdf"]http://www.intel.com/content/dam/www...-datasheet.pdf[/URL]

Read that and you will understand why I cannot answer why your SLP_S4 is not there.
I did ask if it was pulsing, could pulse once or could cycle. Measure while plugging in power to not miss the one pulse. Use a scope as multimeter is too slow to catch a single pulse.[/QUOTE]

Thank you. Page 69 power management interface may also be useful.

5V_S4 is now working.
CPU turns on.
No chime.
MagSafe only has green light.

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message: Check CPU Core voltage and see if it drops in voltage after a second or if it comes on and off and on again.

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message: Also magsafe being only green looks like SMC issue, probably crap under it.

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 7794"]Also magsafe being only green looks like SMC issue, probably crap under it.[/QUOTE]


Thing is, when the boards was not powering on there was green / orange.
I have already replaced SMC this morning.
Checked PP3V42 getting to pull ups.
Checked pull up resistor values.

[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 7794"]  Check CPU Core voltage and see if it drops in voltage after a second or if it comes on and off and on again.
 
 [/QUOTE]

I will check shortly.

Thanks

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message: PPVCC-S0_CPU = 1.08V constant

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message: Well, this could be anything at this point. The usual suspects is the clock chip or corrosion on SPI ROM data lines. Besides that this is just a rabbit hole board.

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message:
Yeah it was pretty fucked. I'll leave it here then and try SPI data lines and clock chip as both had corrosion.
Thank you for your help

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message: Yes!! It boots. No audio though.

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message: Audio is on the IO board, so probably bad connector/cable/IO board.

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 7832"]Audio is on the IO board, so probably bad connector/cable/IO board. [/QUOTE]

So I have tested 3 IO boards and cables. Bleeped out the board connector on J9500, checked all solder joints are OK.
Checked the enables are good for audio around U8040, even replaced U6410 and anything in it's path....

I feel like I have come too far with this board to give up because of audio!
I have pretty much rebuilt the entire board because there were little girl tears over this fucked MacBook which is why I did not just laugh and send it back.

Any more clues or are we at the end?

Thanks for your efforts

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message: Check Q1920 circuit and all other HDA data lines.

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message: Where is the origin of the audio signal?... I mean before amplification or anything.

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message:
The OS does at least know there is an audio device it just does not output any audio.
Probably put this board to one side for a day or so now.

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message:
SPKRAMP_SHDN_L high? Verify voltage on C9520.
If you can change volume in OSX data to audio chip is ok. Try with a headphone too.

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message:
C9520 = 1.5V
SPKRAMP_SHDN_L = low = 0V
Yes level shift on volume but no Headphones output or speaker. Get audio on BlueTooth.

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message: Well SPKRAMP should be high! Is generated on the IO board. Did you check all HDA lines at J9500 on diode mode? AUD_PWR_EN high?

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 7870"]Well SPKRAMP should be high! Is generated on the IO board. Did you check all HDA lines at J9500 on diode mode? AUD_PWR_EN high?[/QUOTE]

SPKRAMP: New IO on the way in case all my IO boards are fucked which is possible I guess.
HDA lines on J9500 no shorts.... Are you asking exact drop across each?
AUD_PWR_EN high.

I live in hope that I am a complete numpty without a working OI as I may have swapped them all out. Get back in a couple of days. Actually amazed this board boots at all :)
Thanks for your help

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message: SPKRAMP not being pulled down by the board? bad U6410, measure diode mode.

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 7928"]SPKRAMP not being pulled down by the board? bad U6410, measure diode mode.[/QUOTE]

SHDN low
Just found that a pads that "looked" there, are actually not there. SHDN and GAIN
I will replace U6410 and test diode mode etc.

Double checked continuity to all pins to J9500 back to anything audio and all good. Resistors OK, no shorts.
No headphones, is bluetooth, internal is recognised and volume shift.

I wonder if tying SHDN to PVDD will work

title: 820-00165 No S0, SYSCLK(s) trying to turn on, corrosion all over
message: Analog section of the audio chip must not be powered. Only power source I see for that is pin 9 or 28. See if R9501 is really no stuff and check continuity of pin 9 through the connector/cable to the io board.
